Interface LogHandler

All Known Subinterfaces:
LogEntryHandler
All Known Implementing Classes:
ConsoleHandler, LogBuffer
public interface LogHandler
Represents a functional interface for handling log entries.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    LogFilter
    getFilter()
    Retrieves the current filter used for determining which log entries should be processed.
    void
    handle(Instant instant, String loggerName, LogLevel lvl, String mrk, Supplier<String> msg, String location, @Nullable Throwable t)
    Handles a log entry.
    default boolean
    isEnabled(LogLevel lvl)
    Determines whether logging is enabled for a specific log level.
    String
    name()
    Retrieves the name of the log entry handler.
    void
    setFilter(LogFilter filter)
    Sets the filter to be used for determining which log entries should be processed.

  • Method Details

    • name

      String name()
      Retrieves the name of the log entry handler.
      Returns:
      the name of the log entry handler as a String

    • isEnabled

      default boolean isEnabled(LogLevel lvl)
      Determines whether logging is enabled for a specific log level.
      Parameters:
      lvl - the log level to check
      Returns:
      true if logging is enabled for the specified log level, otherwise false

    • handle

      void handle(Instant instant, String loggerName, LogLevel lvl, String mrk, Supplier<String> msg, String location, @Nullable Throwable t)
      Handles a log entry.
      Parameters:
      instant - the timestamp of the log entry
      loggerName - the name of the logger
      lvl - the log level of the log entry
      mrk - the marker associated with the log entry, or null if none
      msg - the message of the log entry
      location - the location in the code where the log entry was created
      t - the throwable associated with the log entry, or null if none

    • setFilter

      void setFilter(LogFilter filter)
      Sets the filter to be used for determining which log entries should be processed.
      Parameters:
      filter - the filter used to include or exclude log entries; must not be null

    • getFilter

      LogFilter getFilter()
      Retrieves the current filter used for determining which log entries should be processed.
      Returns:
      the LogEntryFilter that is currently set; never null
